meanings.definition: To blend or merge gradually into one another.
meanings.sent1: The colors of the sunset were intergrading beautifully in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The river and the lake intergraded seamlessly at the meeting point.
meanings.sent3: The flavors in the recipe were intergrading like best friends at a party.
meanings.sent4: The music and the dance intergraded to create a mesmerizing performance.
meanings.sent5: The laughter and joy intergrading in the room made it feel like a celebration.

meanings.definition: To cause to blend or merge gradually into one another.
meanings.sent1: She carefully intergraded the different paint colors on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The chef intergraded the spices to create a delicious dish.
meanings.sent3: The magician intergraded the tricks to create a mind-boggling show.
meanings.sent4: The conductor intergraded the instruments to produce a harmonious symphony.
meanings.sent5: The teacher intergrading the lessons to make learning fun and engaging.
